snippet: Questions have arisen as to why two prominent agents were not mentioned in the Mitchell report on steroid use in baseball, even when players they represented were implicated.
abstract: Baseball officials are questioning why agents Sam and Seth Levinson did not appear in George Mitchell's 2005 steroid report when Mitchell was told in the course of his investigation that the agents played a role in helping their clients procure steroids.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and JULIET MACUR

lead_paragraph: Questions have arisen as to why two prominent agents were not mentioned in the Mitchell report on steroid use in baseball, even when players they represented were implicated.

headline.seo: Questions Surround Two Agents Absent From Mitchell Report
headline.main: Questions Surround Agents Absent From Steroids Report
headline.print_headline: Questions Surround Two Agents Absent From Report on Steroid Use
